description:
Hi Guys:

I found vm stuck "deleting" when delete vm after enable iscsi_use_multipath. If I set iscsi_use_multipath=False, It's ok when delete vm. 

Meanwhile, If I restart nova-compute service on compute node, I will see the "deleting" vm is disappeared on horizon.

version: Ocata.

Environment
===========
# rpm -qa | grep nova
openstack-nova-compute-15.0.3-2.el7.noarch
python2-novaclient-7.1.0-1.el7.noarch
python-nova-15.0.3-2.el7.noarch
openstack-nova-common-15.0.3-2.el7.noarch

1. Which hypervisor did you use?
Libvirt + KVM,  

2. Which storage type did you use?
Netapp Storage.

3. Which networking type did you use?
Neutron with OpenVSwitch
title: vm stuck 'deleting' when delete vm after enable iscsi_use_multipath

comments.content:
Hi Guys:

I found vm stuck "deleting" when delete vm after enable iscsi_use_multipath. If I set iscsi_use_multipath=False, It's ok when delete vm. 

Meanwhile, If I restart nova-compute service on compute node, I will see the "deleting" vm is disappeared on horizon.

version: Ocata.

Environment
===========
# rpm -qa | grep nova
openstack-nova-compute-15.0.3-2.el7.noarch
python2-novaclient-7.1.0-1.el7.noarch
python-nova-15.0.3-2.el7.noarch
openstack-nova-common-15.0.3-2.el7.noarch

1. Which hypervisor did you use?
Libvirt + KVM,  

2. Which storage type did you use?
Netapp Storage.

3. Which networking type did you use?
Neutron with OpenVSwitch
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~margin2017

comments.content: Automatically discovered version ocata in description. If this is incorrect, please update the description to include 'nova version: ...'
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sdague

comments.content:
I'd also suggest providing `multipath -ll` output from the compute node after an attempted delete.

In any case this will likely end up being an os-brick issue so I'm looping them in now.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~lyarwood

comments.content: Assuming this is an os-brick issue for now, @lyarwood, any update on this?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sdague
